{"body": {"name": "Free-to-Use Aggregator Dashboard For the Near Community", "summary": "Alphaday helps solve the issue of information fragmentation. We aim to serve as a central point where any user (developer, investor, etc) can instantly get the Near information they need and stay up to date.\\\\n\\\\nActive Users: ~15,000 MAU (organic) \\\\nAverage Session Time Per User: 9 minutes\\\\nRetention Rate Across 1/7/30 Days: 56%/53%/50%\\\\n\\\\nEstablished Partners: Aave, Chiliz, TheGraph, Avalanche, Metis, Dfinity, Zcash, XRPL, Ethereum Classic, RocketPool, Starknet and others.", "category": "Engagement & Awareness", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": null, "description": "We would like to create a Near ecosystem dashboard that aggregates the following information into a single community dashboard:\\\\n\\\\n- The latest Near official announcements and blog post content.\\\\n- A feed of all news mentions of Near from coindesk, cointelegraph and 20+ other news sources aggregated from across the internet.\\\\n- A calendar containing all Near events including Governance votes, meetups, conferences, hackathons with bounties, AMAs.\\\\n- Podcast feed featuring Near.\\\\n- Youtube stream containing educational Near content.\\\\n- Integration with Near Governance Forum to show the latest and trending discussion topics.\\\\n- Discord & Reddit Integration to show a feed of latest discussions.\\\\n- FAQ, Whitepaper, NEAR tokenomics information.\\\\n- Live NEAR spot price chart.\\\\n- Comprehensive list of Developer tools, API\\\\u{2019}s, tutorials, guides, brand toolkit, grants & bounties, documentation, technical papers, and any other resources that can help build on Near.\\\\n- Near Careers integration to show the latest open jobs listed.\\\\n- Near TVL data through Defillama integration.\\\\n- A widget featuring the Near roadmap (Plans for 2024) with all the descriptions included.\\\\n- Categorized links and descriptions of products and services offered in the Near ecosystem.\\\\n\\\\nWe should be able to build and deploy the above dashboard within 1-2 months so if this grant is approved we want to launch the Near dashboard by June 1st, 2024 (tentatively).\\\\n\\\\nThereafter, we will maintain & curate the dashboard on a regular basis, as well as improve the functionality and availability of features in our application as a whole.\\\\n\\\\nExample of dashboard built for Aave through a grant agreement: https://app.alphaday.com/b/aave/\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "bff3b9a1e53713ffe55308da1e0f00ff33087ffd4e3bd73f45736bb335176df8", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "4000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": []}

{"data": {"devhub.near": {"post": {"main": "{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"text\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"We have just received a new *Engagement & Awareness* proposal.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**By**: @bff3b9a1e53713ffe55308da1e0f00ff33087ffd4e3bd73f45736bb335176df8\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Title**: \\\\u{201c}Free-to-Use Aggregator Dashboard For the Near Community\\\\u{201c}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Summary**:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nAlphaday helps solve the issue of information fragmentation. We aim to serve as a central point where any user (developer, investor, etc) can instantly get the Near information they need and stay up to date.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nActive Users: ~15,000 MAU (organic) \\\\\\\\nAverage Session Time Per User: 9 minutes\\\\\\\\nRetention Rate Across 1/7/30 Days: 56%/53%/50%\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nEstablished Partners: Aave, Chiliz, TheGraph, Avalanche, Metis, Dfinity, Zcash, XRPL, Ethereum Classic, RocketPool, Starknet and others.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nRead the full proposal and share your feedback on [DevHub](/devhub.near/widget/app?page=proposal&id=35)\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}"}}}}

{"handle": "devrel", "community_addon": {"id": "dqnckr", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{\\\\\\\"title\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"Quarterly Updates \\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"subtitle\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"content\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\\n### DevHub Developer Relations Q1 2024 Report\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n*Empowering Developers, Building Communities*\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nIn the first quarter of 2024, DevHub\\\\\\'s Developer Relations team has continued its relentless efforts in building a vibrant developer ecosystem within NEAR. Through a series of strategic initiatives, content creation, engaging events. The team has significantly enhanced developer outreach, education, and support. Here\\\\\\'s a detailed overview of our key highlights and statistics for Q1 \\\\u{1f973}:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**1. Initiatives/Developer Outreach:**\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Developer Newsletter:** Our weekly technical updates have provided developers with invaluable insights into the latest developments within the ecosystem, fostering a sense of connectivity and awareness.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Coding Challenges:** Monthly coding challenges for developers to hone their skills while tackling real-world problems.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Office Hours:** Real-time support and personalized 1:1 sessions have been instrumental in addressing developers\\\\\\' queries promptly and effectively.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Developer Survey on Tooling:** We conducted a comprehensive survey to gather feedback on tooling, ensuring that our resources align closely with developers\\\\\\' needs and preferences.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **NEAR Campus Activities:** Through workshops and engagements with universities worldwide, including ASU, UCSB, Boston University, UC San Diego, University of Calgary, Cambridge, Intelli, and Oxford, we\\\\\\'ve successfully introduced NEAR Protocol to the next generation of developers.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Technical Support Channels:** Our presence on Discord, Telegram groups, and the DevHub community pages has facilitated seamless communication and support for developers at every stage of their journey.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Proposals:** We\\\\\\'ve efficiently triaged proposals and connected developers with subject matter experts, streamlining the process and ensuring timely attestation.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**2. Content Creation:**\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Blogs:** With a commitment to consistent and informative content, we\\\\\\'ve published two tutorials and one comprehensive recap of DevHub activities in 2023, reaching developers globally.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Recaps:** Through 5 detailed recaps of work group calls and community discussions posted on YouTube, we\\\\\\'ve provided transparency and insights into our initiatives\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Developer Newsletter:** With five editions published in Q1, our newsletter continues to be a reliable source of updates and knowledge for developers\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**3. Trainings, Events, and Workshops:**\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **University Engagements:** From Blockchain at ASU to engagements with universities worldwide, we\\\\\\'ve conducted workshops and presentations, attracting over 400 attendees and nurturing future talent.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Online Workshops:** Leveraging the digital landscape, we\\\\\\'ve conducted workshops online, ensuring accessibility and inclusivity for developers globally.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Event Participation:** Our active participation in events like ETHDenver and ETHSamba, has expanded our reach and strengthened our connections within the broader developer community.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**4. WG Calls/Community Calls/Twitter Spaces:**\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Protocol WG Calls:** Through two protocol working group calls and numerous community engagements, we\\\\\\'ve facilitated meaningful discussions and collaborations among NEP Authors, moderators and community members.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Office Hours and Community Calls:** With over 26 sessions and three community calls, we\\\\\\'ve provided ample opportunities for developers to connect, learn, and share insights.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Twitter Spaces:** Our Twitter Space garnered significant attention, reaching over 1.1k viewers and amplifying our message within the community.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**5. Platform Support (Community Page Management):**\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Community Page Management:** By updating 9 community pages with relevant information and call recaps, we\\\\\\'ve ensured that developers have access to up-to-date resources and insights.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n*DevHub Developer Relations Team*\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"textAlign\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"left\\\\\\\"}", "display_name": "Updates \\\\u{26a1}\\\\u{fe0f}"}}

{"handle": "devrel", "community_addon": {"id": "dqnckr", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{\\\\\\\"title\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"Quarterly Updates \\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"subtitle\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"content\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\\n### DevHub Developer Relations Q1 2024 Report\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n*Empowering Developers, Building Communities*\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nIn the first quarter of 2024, Our team has continued its efforts in building a vibrant developer ecosystem within NEAR. Through a series of strategic initiatives, content creation and  engaging events. We significantly enhanced developer outreach, education, and support. Here\\\\\\'s a detailed overview of our key highlights and statistics for Q1 \\\\u{1f973}:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**1. Initiatives/Developer Outreach:**\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Developer Newsletter:** Our weekly technical updates have provided developers with invaluable insights into the latest developments within the ecosystem, fostering a sense of connectivity and awareness.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Coding Challenges:** Monthly coding challenges for developers to hone their skills while tackling real-world problems.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Office Hours:** Real-time support and personalized 1:1 sessions have been instrumental in addressing developers\\\\\\' queries promptly and effectively.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Developer Survey on Tooling:** We conducted a comprehensive survey to gather feedback on tooling, ensuring that our resources align closely with developers\\\\\\' needs and preferences.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **NEAR Campus Activities:** Through workshops and engagements with universities worldwide, including ASU, UCSB, Boston University, UC San Diego, University of Calgary, Cambridge, Intelli, and Oxford, we\\\\\\'ve successfully introduced NEAR Protocol to the next generation of developers.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Technical Support Channels:** Our presence on Discord, Telegram groups, and the DevHub community pages has facilitated seamless communication and support for developers at every stage of their journey.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Proposals:** We\\\\\\'ve efficiently triaged proposals and connected developers with subject matter experts, streamlining the process and ensuring timely attestation.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**2. Content Creation:**\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Blogs:** With a commitment to consistent and informative content, we\\\\\\'ve published two tutorials and one comprehensive recap of DevHub activities in 2023, reaching developers globally.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Recaps:** Through 5 detailed recaps of work group calls and community discussions posted on YouTube, we\\\\\\'ve provided transparency and insights into our initiatives\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Developer Newsletter:** With five editions published in Q1, our newsletter continues to be a reliable source of updates and knowledge for developers\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**3. Trainings, Events, and Workshops:**\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **University Engagements:** From Blockchain at ASU to engagements with universities worldwide, we\\\\\\'ve conducted workshops and presentations, attracting over 400 attendees and nurturing future talent.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Online Workshops:** Leveraging the digital landscape, we\\\\\\'ve conducted workshops online, ensuring accessibility and inclusivity for developers globally.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Event Participation:** Our active participation in events like ETHDenver and ETHSamba, has expanded our reach and strengthened our connections within the broader developer community.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**4. WG Calls/Community Calls/Twitter Spaces:**\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Protocol WG Calls:** Through two protocol working group calls and numerous community engagements, we\\\\\\'ve facilitated meaningful discussions and collaborations among NEP Authors, moderators and community members.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Office Hours and Community Calls:** With over 26 sessions and three community calls, we\\\\\\'ve provided ample opportunities for developers to connect, learn, and share insights.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Twitter Spaces:** Our Twitter Space garnered significant attention, reaching over 1.1k viewers and amplifying our message within the community.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**5. Platform Support (Community Page Management):**\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Community Page Management:** By updating 9 community pages with relevant information and call recaps, we\\\\\\'ve ensured that developers have access to up-to-date resources and insights.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n*DevHub Developer Relations Team*\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"textAlign\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"left\\\\\\\"}", "display_name": "Updates \\\\u{26a1}\\\\u{fe0f}"}}

{"handle": "devrel", "community_addon": {"id": "dqnckr", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{\\\\\\\"title\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"Quarterly Updates \\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"subtitle\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"content\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\\n### DevHub Developer Relations Q1 2024 Report\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n*Empowering Developers, Building Communities*\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nIn the first quarter of 2024, Our team has continued its efforts in building a vibrant developer ecosystem within NEAR. Through a series of strategic initiatives, content creation and  engaging events. We significantly enhanced developer outreach, education, and support. Here\\\\\\'s a detailed overview of our key highlights and statistics for Q1 \\\\u{1f973}:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**1. Initiatives/Developer Outreach:**\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Developer Newsletter:** Our weekly technical updates have provided developers with tips, releases, and the latest developments within the ecosystem.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Coding Challenges:** Monthly coding challenges for developers to hone their skills while tackling real-world problems.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Office Hours:** Real-time support and personalized 1:1 sessions have been instrumental in addressing developers\\\\\\' queries promptly and effectively.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Developer Survey on Tooling:** We conducted a comprehensive survey to gather feedback on tooling, ensuring that our resources align closely with developers\\\\\\' needs and preferences.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **NEAR Campus Activities:** Through workshops and engagements with universities worldwide, including ASU, UCSB, Boston University, UC San Diego, University of Calgary, Cambridge, Intelli, and Oxford, we\\\\\\'ve successfully introduced NEAR Protocol to the next generation of developers.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Technical Support Channels:** Our presence on Discord, Telegram groups, and the DevHub community pages has facilitated seamless communication and support for developers at every stage of their journey.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Proposals:** We\\\\\\'ve efficiently triaged proposals and connected developers with subject matter experts, streamlining the process and ensuring timely attestation.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**2. Content Creation:**\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Blogs:** With a commitment to consistent and informative content, we\\\\\\'ve published two tutorials and one comprehensive recap of DevHub activities in 2023, reaching developers globally.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Recaps:** Through 5 detailed recaps of work group calls and community discussions posted on YouTube, we\\\\\\'ve provided transparency and insights into our initiatives\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Developer Newsletter:** With five editions published in Q1, our newsletter continues to be a reliable source of updates and knowledge for developers\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**3. Trainings, Events, and Workshops:**\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **University Engagements:** From Blockchain at ASU to engagements with universities worldwide, we\\\\\\'ve conducted workshops and presentations, attracting over 400 attendees and nurturing future talent.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Online Workshops:** Leveraging the digital landscape, we\\\\\\'ve conducted workshops online, ensuring accessibility and inclusivity for developers globally.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Event Participation:** Our active participation in events like ETHDenver and ETHSamba, has expanded our reach and strengthened our connections within the broader developer community.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**4. WG Calls/Community Calls/Twitter Spaces:**\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Protocol WG Calls:** Through two protocol working group calls and numerous community engagements, we\\\\\\'ve facilitated meaningful discussions and collaborations among NEP Authors, moderators and community members.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Office Hours and Community Calls:** With over 26 sessions and three community calls, we\\\\\\'ve provided ample opportunities for developers to connect, learn, and share insights.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Twitter Spaces:** Our Twitter Space garnered significant attention, reaching over 1.1k viewers and amplifying our message within the community.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**5. Platform Support (Community Page Management):**\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Community Page Management:** By updating 9 community pages with relevant information and call recaps, we\\\\\\'ve ensured that developers have access to up-to-date resources and insights.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n*DevHub Developer Relations Team*\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"textAlign\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"left\\\\\\\"}", "display_name": "Updates \\\\u{26a1}\\\\u{fe0f}"}}

{"data": {"devrel.community.devhub.near": {"profile": {"name": "Decentralized DevRel", "tags": {"devrel": "", "community": "", "announcements": ""}, "image": {"url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreignlfyjejbvnclxbkiybjejjjqgelvrjyqxd4gscb2maoy3qw7ame"}, "linktree": {"github": null, "twitter": null, "website": "near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=devrel", "telegram": "+niaMtWIjY3ZlZTVh"}, "description": "A group of community contributors who engage with the NEAR developer community, gather feedback, and coordinate community calls and events.\\\\n\\\\nLearn more about our community [on DevHub](/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=devrel).", "backgroundImage": {"url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreicic7xwcw4no6kqpcqlhe3hcszlkfp5u53yw5a4x4lap3uzlndbcm"}}}, "discussions.devrel.community.devhub.near": {"profile": {"name": "Decentralized DevRel (Community Discussions)", "tags": {"devrel": "", "community": "", "discussions": ""}, "image": {"url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreignlfyjejbvnclxbkiybjejjjqgelvrjyqxd4gscb2maoy3qw7ame"}, "linktree": {"github": null, "twitter": null, "website": "near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=devrel", "telegram": "+niaMtWIjY3ZlZTVh"}, "description": "Providing community management and support to developers\\\\n\\\\nLearn more about our community [on DevHub](/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=devrel).", "backgroundImage": {"url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreicic7xwcw4no6kqpcqlhe3hcszlkfp5u53yw5a4x4lap3uzlndbcm"}}}}}

{"addons": [{"id": "des7nb", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{\\\\\\\"title\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"Overview\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"subtitle\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"About the Protocol Community\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"content\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"## Who are we\\\\\\\\nWithin the NEAR ecosystem, Protocol refers to the layer 1 blockchain, the foundation of NEAR ([ref](https://nomicon.io/Architecture)); contributors of Protocol mostly work on nearcore Github repository, containing critical implementation powering NEAR protocol blockchain including chain, sharding, network, storage and runtime. Through various researches, investigations, and rigorous discussions, we aim to build secure, reliable, and scalable blockchain infrastructure, where the vision of Blockchain OS and innovative Web3 apps can live on. \\\\\\\\nIf you are interested in how NEAR blockchain works and want to make contributions, this is the place for you!\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n------\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## What is this space about\\\\\\\\nThis space aims to serve as an entry point to individuals, experts, and organizations who are interested in contributing to the ongoing innovation of the NEAR protocol. You will be able to find information about ongoing community programs, access to relevant documentations, and communication channels for you to participate in.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n------\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Community Groups\\\\\\\\nAs of now, the Protocol community consists of two groups: working group(PWG) and community group.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n------\\\\\\\\n### Protocol working group\\\\\\\\nThis formal group is a selected committee of subject matter experts who make official decisions on proposals related to the NEAR protocol. They follow a strict process to review proposals, recommend funding to DAO or grant programs, and hold grant takers accountable. They engage with the broader community to understand their needs and encourage ideation. Due to its significance, we pay special attention to the member selection process and make sure that each member can bring unique perspectives and experiences to improve NEAR protocol. With great power comes great responsibility.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### Current committee members\\\\\\\\nA protocol working group member will constantly seek a community member with deep expertise on how protocol works. When a qualified candidate is discovered, the committee goes through the nomination and alignment process to send an invitation.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nCurrent committee members are as follows:\\\\\\\\n* Bowen Wang ([Pagoda](https://www.pagoda.co/))\\\\\\\\n  * Near social: [@woben.near](https://near.social/#/mob.near/widget/ProfilePage?accountId=woben.near)\\\\\\\\n  * Github: [bowenwang1996](https://github.com/bowenwang1996)\\\\\\\\n* Marcelo Fornet\\\\\\\\n  * Near social: [@marcelo.near](https://near.social/#/mob.near/widget/ProfilePage?accountId=marcelo.near)\\\\\\\\n  * Github: [mfornet](https://github.com/mfornet)\\\\\\\\n  * Telegram: mnaeraxr\\\\\\\\n* Marcin Michalski ([Matter Labs](https://matter-labs.io/))\\\\\\\\n  * Github: [mm-near](https://github.com/mm-near)\\\\\\\\n* Michael Birch (Aurora)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### Responsibility\\\\\\\\n* Make decisions on Near Enhancement Proposals(A.K.A NEPs)\\\\\\\\n* Budget allocation for protocol development initiatives including RFPs, security audits, etc. This includes review of funding requests.\\\\\\\\n* Steer the general direction of protocol development\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### Communication channels\\\\\\\\n* Attend Protocol work group calls \\\\\\\\n* Message on Telegram channel: [link](https://t.me/NEAR_Protocol_Community_Group)\\\\\\\\n* Post on NEAR.org and tag [Pagoda](https://near.org/near/widget/ProfilePage?accountId=pagodaplatform.near)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n------\\\\\\\\n### Protocol community group\\\\\\\\nCommunity group is an open group providing a space for anyone interested in changes to the NEAR protocol. Unlike the Protocol working group, the community group does not require any commitment or membership. It focuses on offering a place where members can freely ask questions, seek/offer support, exchange ideas and initiate discussions. All contributors to nearcore repository, including [Pagoda](https://www.pagoda.co/) protocol team members, are implicit members of the community, and actively participate in community discussions.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n* [Protocol Community Group TG Channel](https://t.me/NEAR_Protocol_Community_Group)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### Ongoing projects\\\\\\\\n* [Protocol roadmap](https://medium.com/nearprotocol/q1-protocol-roadmap-update-progress-and-changes-e2d61626e4a1)\\\\\\\\n* Github \\\\\\\\n  * [Major projects](https://github.com/near/nearcore/labels/C-tracking-issue)\\\\\\\\n  * [Discussions](https://github.com/near/nearcore/discussions)\\\\\\\\n  * [PRs](https://github.com/near/nearcore/pulls)\\\\\\\\n* [Sponsored projects](https://near.social/#/devgovgigs.near/widget/gigs-board.pages.community.Sponsorship?label=protocol)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Communication channels\\\\\\\\n* Attend periodic Protocol community group calls\\\\\\\\n* [Telegram channel](https://t.me/NEAR_Protocol_Community_Group)\\\\\\\\n* [Zulip](https://near.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/295558-pagoda.2Fcore)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n------\\\\\\\\n## Documents\\\\\\\\nProtocol community maintains several documents/wikis so community members can stay informative and efficient to find what they are seeking for. Here are major worth noting ones.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n* [Guide to nearcore development](https://near.github.io/nearcore/index.html): Explains how each part of nearcore operates, e.g. how state sync, garbage collection, epoch works, how storage layer interacts with the layers on top, etc.\\\\\\\\n* [Nomicon](https://nomicon.io/): Near protocol specification\\\\\\\\n* [Near nodes](https://near-nodes.io/): Explains how near node works and how one can become a node operator \\\\\\\\n* [Near doc](https://docs.near.org/develop/welcome): Walks you through on how to develop on top of NEAR protocol, e.g. how to build a smart contract on NEAR\\\\\\\\n* [Rust](https://www.rust-lang.org/learn): Learn Rust, the programming language NEAR protocol is written in\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"textAlign\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"left\\\\\\\"}", "display_name": "About Us \\\\u{2b50}\\\\u{fe0f}"}, {"id": "730ru7", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{\\\\\\\"title\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"How to contribute\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"subtitle\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"content\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"Protocol community group runs various events and programs you can participate in to improve NEAR blockchain. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n# Virtual meet ups\\\\\\\\nStay up-to-date on upcoming and past events in the NEAR protocol space. Whether it\\\\u{2019}s a monthly community call, hackathon, or meetup, you\\\\u{2019}ll find the details here to connect with other community members.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nCurrently, we have two periodic virtual meetups, one for general community group and another for working group.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n------\\\\\\\\n### Community Calls\\\\\\\\nThe Protocol Community Group hosts a monthly call to connect, share ideas or concerns, and stay up-to-date on the latest developments in the NEAR protocol.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### How to join the call\\\\\\\\nFind out about the latest meetings below or on our [Telegram channel](https://t.me/NEAR_Protocol_Community_Group).\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Who can attend\\\\\\\\nAnyone is welcome to attend the monthly call. Whether you\\\\\\'re an individual, organization, or an expert in the NEAR Protocol, it is open to all. Each call is recorded and posted on this page.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Format\\\\\\\\nThe monthly call is a free-format discussion with basic moderation. Anyone can volunteer to facilitate and lead future calls. The agenda typically starts with introductions from participants and follows with a list of potential discussion topics. The group will prioritize the topics based on what participants want to discuss the most. Topics may include updates from various members on any developments or initiatives, presentations on the latest research, as well as open discussion from questions and ideas to challenges and opportunities.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n------\\\\\\\\n## Work Group Calls\\\\\\\\nMostly, Protocol Working group reviews and discusses NEP asynchronously within the NEP\\\\u{2019}s public thread. This allows for broad participation and ensures transparency.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nHowever, if a discussion becomes circular and could benefit from a synchronous conversation, the Protocol Working Group may host public formal calls to review specific proposals, discuss attestations, or vote on decisions. For example, if a reviewer and author have multiple rounds of comments, they may request a call. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n------\\\\\\\\n## Monthly protocol engineer virtual meetup day\\\\\\\\nOnce a month, protocol engineers meet virtually on [Gather town](https://app.gather.town/app) to simulate \\\\u{2018}office working environment\\\\u{2019} by presenting in the virtual workspace during their work hours. By doing so, we encourage adhoc discussions and conversations to build stronger relationships and maximize our creativity. During this day, we also host a social hour so we can have fun activities together as well.\\\\\\\\nVirtual working day schedule is shared on [Zulip general stream](https://near.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/295302-general/topic/virtual.20meetup.20day)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n------\\\\\\\\n------\\\\\\\\n# Bug bounty program\\\\\\\\nBug bounty program is to leverage power of community to make NEAR protocol more secure and fraud-proof. If you notice any issues that can be a threat to our users on nearcore repo, please report them and claim the bounty! Please follow the [LINK](https://hackenproof.com/near/near-protocol) to Hacken proof Near protocol page to know more about the program\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n------\\\\\\\\n------\\\\\\\\n# Funding Proposal\\\\\\\\nIf you have the idea that can make NEAR protocol more scalable/reliable/secure, you can submit a proposal to get funding for your precious time and effort. Currently, NEAR DevDAO is running the funding program by collaborating with Protocol working group. Once a proposal is submitted, DevDAO will work with Protocol working group to determine the necessity of the project by thoroughly reviewing the proposal. Once conclusion is made, DevDAO will reach out to the proposer to share the final decision and work with them on the next step.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nTo learn more about the guidelines and how to submit a proposal for funding, please visit [here](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=developer-dao&tab=funding). \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### How to participate\\\\\\\\nThere are several ways to participate in community activities. Here are common examples. \\\\\\\\n##### You have a feedback to share with developers or want to initiate a discussion\\\\\\\\n* Create a topic in [Zulip pagoda/core stream](https://near.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/295558-pagoda.2Fcore)\\\\\\\\n* Protocol community group discussion board\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n##### You want to know more about the NEAR protocol and have questions\\\\\\\\n* Ask a question in [Zulip pagoda/core/questions topic](https://near.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/295558-pagoda.2Fcore/topic/questions)\\\\\\\\n* As a question in [Protocol telegram](https://t.me/NEAR_Protocol_Community_Group)\\\\\\\\n* Protocol community group discussion board\\\\\\\\n* Post your question on [Near social](https://near.social/)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n##### You want to learn about NEAR protocol by working on a simple issue\\\\\\\\n* Request an onboarding task in [Zulip pagoda/core stream](https://near.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/295558-pagoda.2Fcore)\\\\\\\\n* Check out Github issues labeled with good-first-issue: [link](https://github.com/near/nearcore/labels/C-good-first-issue)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n##### You want to talk to Pagoda protocol team\\\\\\\\n* Simply start a conversation in [Zulip pagoda/core stream](https://near.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/295558-pagoda.2Fcore) and tag @ protocol\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n##### You want to know more about proposals on protocol specification\\\\\\\\n* Visit [Github NEP board](https://github.com/orgs/near/projects/51/views/3) to see open/completed proposals\\\\\\\\n* Read through [Near Enhancement Proposal guideline](https://github.com/near/NEPs/blob/master/neps/nep-0001.md) to learn about NEP approval process how to submit a proposal\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n##### You have an idea and want to request funding\\\\\\\\n* Please check \\\\u{2018}Event\\\\u{2019} tab\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n##### You have found a bug on NEAR and want to claim reward via bug bounty program\\\\\\\\n* Please check \\\\u{2018}Event\\\\u{2019} tab\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"textAlign\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"left\\\\\\\"}", "display_name": "How to contribute \\\\u{1f468}\\\\u{200d}\\\\u{1f4bb}"}, {"id": "3i6q64", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "blog", "parameters": "{}", "display_name": "Community Calls / Events \\\\u{1f3c6}"}, {"id": "jje4bb", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "github", "parameters": "{}", "display_name": "GitHub"}], "handle": "protocol"}

With great power comes great responsibility.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### WG Members\\\\\\\\nA protocol working group member will constantly seek a community member with deep expertise on how protocol works. When a qualified candidate is discovered, the committee goes through the nomination and alignment process to send an invitation.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nCurrent committee members are as follows:\\\\\\\\n* Bowen Wang ([Pagoda](https://www.pagoda.co/))\\\\\\\\n  * Near social: [@woben.near](https://near.social/#/mob.near/widget/ProfilePage?accountId=woben.near)\\\\\\\\n  * Github: [bowenwang1996](https://github.com/bowenwang1996)\\\\\\\\n* Marcelo Fornet\\\\\\\\n  * Near social: [@marcelo.near](https://near.social/#/mob.near/widget/ProfilePage?accountId=marcelo.near)\\\\\\\\n  * Github: [mfornet](https://github.com/mfornet)\\\\\\\\n  * Telegram: mnaeraxr\\\\\\\\n* Marcin Michalski ([Matter Labs](https://matter-labs.io/))\\\\\\\\n  * Github: [mm-near](https://github.com/mm-near)\\\\\\\\n* Michael Birch (Aurora)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### WG Responsibilities\\\\\\\\n* Make decisions on Near Enhancement Proposals(A.K.A NEPs)\\\\\\\\n* Budget allocation for protocol development initiatives including RFPs, security audits, etc. This includes review of funding requests.\\\\\\\\n* Steer the general direction of protocol development\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### Communication channels\\\\\\\\n* Attend Protocol work group calls \\\\\\\\n* Message on Telegram channel: [link](https://t.me/NEAR_Protocol_Community_Group)\\\\\\\\n* Post on NEAR.org and tag [Pagoda](https://near.org/near/widget/ProfilePage?accountId=pagodaplatform.near)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n------\\\\\\\\n### Protocol community group\\\\\\\\nCommunity group is an open group providing a space for anyone interested in changes to the NEAR protocol. All contributors to nearcore repository, including [Pagoda](https://www.pagoda.co/) protocol team members, are implicit members of the community, and actively participate in community discussions.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n* [Protocol Community Group TG Channel](https://t.me/NEAR_Protocol_Community_Group)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n#### Ongoing projects\\\\\\\\n* [Protocol roadmap](https://medium.com/nearprotocol/q1-protocol-roadmap-update-progress-and-changes-e2d61626e4a1)\\\\\\\\n* Github \\\\\\\\n  * [Major projects](https://github.com/near/nearcore/labels/C-tracking-issue)\\\\\\\\n  * [Discussions](https://github.com/near/nearcore/discussions)\\\\\\\\n  * [PRs](https://github.com/near/nearcore/pulls)\\\\\\\\n* [Sponsored projects](https://near.social/#/devgovgigs.near/widget/gigs-board.pages.community.Sponsorship?label=protocol)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Communication channels\\\\\\\\n* Attend periodic Protocol community group calls\\\\\\\\n* [Telegram channel](https://t.me/NEAR_Protocol_Community_Group)\\\\\\\\n* [Zulip](https://near.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/295558-pagoda.2Fcore)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"textAlign\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"left\\\\\\\"}", "display_name": "About Us \\\\u{2b50}\\\\u{fe0f}"}}
